title: State Department has nearly doubled the intake of refugees from the seven travel ban countries since judge put a ... - Daily Mail
text: show ad State Department has nearly doubled the intake of refugees from the seven travel ban countries since judge put a halt to the order Since a judge put a half to the travel ban last week, State Department has let 882 refugees from the listed countries into the U.S. That's nearly double the rate of entry that was happening two weeks before Trump signed the executive order Analysts say the sudden increase is a coordinated effort by the State Dept. to let in as many people from these countries before the order may be reinstated Trump wants to stop immigration from the seven countries in an effort to prevent domestic terror attacks This week, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad said that some of the refugees fleeing his Civil War-torn country are 'definitely terrorists' Published: 15:48 GMT, 10 February 2017 | Updated: 21:14 GMT, 10 February 2017 504 shares
